#summary Highlight of image fragment

[v2Main << Back to Main]

=== Highlight of an image fragment ===

Highlighting an image fragment is equivalent to identify a particular region in an image. The fragment selection can be performed with an appropriate _Selector_. In the following example we are using the [v2RectangularImageSelector RectangularImageSelector] which is simply identifying a rectangular region of the referenced image. More elaborate _Selectors_ can be defined for more specific use cases.

[http://annotation-ontology.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/images/v2/Highlight%20image%20fragment%20-%20Annotation%20Ontology%20-%20by%20Paolo%20Ciccarese.png]<br/>
_Figure 1: _

The RDF of the example in picture 1 would look like the following: 

{{{ 
<rdf:Description rdf:about="http://my.example.org/ann/21300"> 
   <rdf:type rdf:resource="&ao;Highlight"/> 
   <!-- The following can be added for querying with SPARQL 
   <rdf:type rdf:resource="&ao;Annotation"/> 
   <rdf:type rdf:resource="&ann;Annotation"/> 
   --> 
   <ao:annotatesResource rdf:resource="http://tinyurl.com/3zgsyo3"/> 
   <ao:context rdf:resource="http://my.example.org/sel/10404"/> 
   <pav:createdOn>2011-08-17</pav:createdOn> 
   <pav:createdBy rdf:resource="http://www.paolociccarese.info#me"/> 
</rdf:Description> 
}}} 

and the text selector ([v2RectangularImageSelector RectangularImageSelector]): 

{{{ 
<rdf:Description rdf:about="http://my.example.org/sel/10404"> 
   <rdf:type rdf:resource="&ao;RectangularImageSelector"/> 
   <!-- 
   <rdf:type rdf:resource="&ao;ImageSelector"/> 
   <rdf:type rdf:resource="&ao;Selector"/> 
   --> 
   <ao:init>(10, 200)</ao:init> 
   <ao:end>(60, 250)</ao:end> 
   <ao:unit>px</ao:unit> 
   <ao:onResource rdf:resource="http://tinyurl.com/3zgsyo3"/> 
</rdf:Description> 
}}}
